thread.title: UAAP title is NU’s next goal, says Coach Gorayeb
thread.title_full: UAAP title is NU’s next goal, says Coach Gorayeb | mb.com.ph | Philippine News

author: Kristel Satumbaga
title: UAAP title is NU’s next goal, says Coach Gorayeb
text:
by Kristel Satumbaga
October 5, 2015 National University volleyball Coach Roger Gorayeb is setting his sights on helping the Lady Bulldogs win the UAAP title in his second season at the helm after guiding them to the Shakey’s V-League Season 12 Collegiate Conference crown.
“Gusto ko kasing mag-finals ang NU this year sa UAAP,” Gorayeb said after NU stunned title-favorite Ateneo, 25-21, 26-24, 25-19, in the deciding game of their best-of-three title series last Sunday at The Arena in San Juan.
The National University Lady Bulldogs whoop it up after winning the Shakey’s V-League title. (Bob Dungo Jr.)
“Yun talaga ang pangarap ko, kasi yun naman yung purpose ko dyan sa NU: para sa UAAP.”
Gorayeb took charge last January but failed to lift the Lady Bulldogs past the UAAP Final Four.
But the V-League title victory, despite the presence of guest players Dindin Santiago-Manabat and Rubie De Leon, has boosted NU’s confidence ahead of the UAAP campaign which opens in February.
Gorayeb cited the improvements of Myla Pablo, who was named the Finals Most Valuable Player for her splendid play in Game 3. He also cited Jorelle Singh as capable of providing support for NU’s top star Jaja Santiago.
“Nakita niyo naman yung improvement nina Myla (Pablo), ni Jorelle (Singh), yung improvement nila sa depensa. Actually, ngayon pa lang nila nakukuha yung mga gusto kong mangyari. Sana magtuluy-tuloy,” Gorayeb said.
It was Gorayeb’s second straight title victory this season after steering PLDT to a thrilling win over Army in the Open Conference last June.
This time, Gorayeb won at the expense of the Lady Eagles, a team he coached from 2008 to 2013.
